result.execSummary:
The defendant Presious L Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and Costs to be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing 12/1/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 2021CT1541 is Dismissed and read in

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Presious L Shields

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:11 PM Defendant Presious L Shields in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Presious L Shields. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	

Count #1:
Fine:  $631.00.
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 12/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions)/entry of civil judgment
Appeal rights given.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with ID processing. No new law violations.

10:41 AM Defendant Presious L Shields in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court as friend of the Court for Presious L Shields.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant will be contacting the PD's office in order to get Atty Martinez appointed on this case. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. NOT GUILTY PLEA entered. .

State requests a signature bond with standard conditions. Defense joins in request. 

Court will set a signature bond in the amount of $200.00.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:41 AM Defendant Presious L Shields in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Presious L Shields.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense states there has been a request made for a squad video, but has not yet received it. Requests to set a plea/sentencing hearing on the same date as co-Defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
